ACROSS THE POND.Defintion: the other side of the Atlantic Ocean

ASCENT.Defintion: the act of climbing or moving upwards

BACKLASH.Defintion: a strong feeling among a group of people in reaction to a change or recent events in society or politics

BUDGE.Defintion: If something will not budge or you cannot budge it, it will not move

COAL.Defintion: a hard, black substance that is dug from the earth in pieces, and can be burned to produce heat or power, or a single piece of this

DESPISED.Defintion: to feel a strong dislike for someone or something because you think that that person or thing is bad or has no value

DIEHARD.Defintion: someone who is unwilling to change or give up their ideas or ways of behaving, even when there are good reasons to do so

DIVISIVE.Defintion: used to describe something or someone that causes great and sometimes unfriendly disagreement within a group of people

DOZENS.Defintion: twelve, a large but not exact number

EMBARKED ON.Defintion: to start something new or important

FABRIC.Defintion: the structure or parts of something

FUNDAMENTALLY.Defintion: in a basic and important way

FUNK.Defintion: the state of being unhappy and without hope

HARDSHIP.Defintion: (something that causes) difficult or unpleasant conditions of life, or an example of this

HAS HIS FAIR SHARE.Defintion: if you have had your fair share of something, you have had a lot of it

HEADLINE.Defintion: a line of words printed in large letters as the title of a story in a newspaper, or the main points of the news that are broadcast on television or radio

HINTED AT.Defintion: to say or do something that shows what you think or want, usually in a way that is not direct

IMPLEMENTED.Defintion: to start using a plan or system

IMPLICATIONS.Defintion: an occasion when you seem to suggest something without saying it directly

INFLATION.Defintion: a general, continuous increase in prices

LAID THE FOUNDATIONS.Defintion: to produce the basic ideas or structures from which something much larger develops

LEGACIES.Defintion: a situation that has developed as a result of past actions and decisions

MANDATE.Defintion: the authority given to an elected group of people, such as a government, to perform an action or govern a country

MIXED.Defintion: showing a mixture of different feelings or opinions

MORTGAGES.Defintion: an agreement that allows you to borrow money from a bank or similar organisation, especially in order to buy a house, or the amount of money itself

NEEDLESSLY.Defintion: in a way that is not necessary

NEOLIBERAL.Defintion: supporting a large amount of freedom for markets, with little government control or spending, and low taxes

NICKNAME.Defintion: an informal name for someone or something, especially a name that you are called by your friends or family, usually based on your real name or your character

NUTRIENTS.Defintion: any substance that plants or animals need in order to live and grow

NUTRITIONAL.Defintion: relating to nutrition, or containing a food substance your body can use

OUTCOMES.Defintion: a result or effect of an action, situation, etc.

PHENOMENON.Defintion: something that exists and can be seen, felt, tasted, etc., especially something unusual or interesting

PROPPING UP.Defintion: to lift and give support to something by putting something under it

PROSPERITY.Defintion: the state of being successful and having a lot of money

PULLOUT.Defintion: in a magazine or newspaper, a set of pages that are intended to be taken out and used separately

REJOICE.Defintion: to feel or show great happiness about something

RELIANCE.Defintion: the state of depending on or trusting in something or someone

ROOT CAUSE.Defintion: the most important cause, the most important reason for something

RUN DEEP.Defintion: If a feeling or problem runs deep, it is strong or serious and has existed for a long time

SET THE STAGE.Defintion: used to mean that conditions have been made right for something to happen, or that something is likely to happen

STINT.Defintion: a fixed or limited period of time spent doing a particular job or activity

THE MEASURE OF.Defintion: to understand what someone or something is like and to know how to deal with him, her, or it

TRADE UNION.Defintion: an organisation that represents the people who work in a particular industry, protects their rights, and discusses their pay and working conditions with employers

TRADE UNIONS.Defintion: an organisation that represents the people who work in a particular industry, protects their rights, and discusses their pay and working conditions with employers

UNPACK.Defintion: to explain or examine something in order to make its meaning clearer

UNPROFITABLE.Defintion: not making a profit, losing money
